; 十年前，新中国历史上第一次周边外交座谈会在北京召开，习近平主席出席并提出了具有里程碑意义的中国周边外交方针— “亲诚惠容”。

;

;周二，习近平在北京举行的纪念这一愿景十周年国际研讨会上致辞。为了彰显北京与邻国共建共建的决心，习近平强调了推进“亚洲现代化”的目标。

;

; 在多位领导人、官员和学者出席的活动上，外交部发布了中国首份系统性总结和总结亚洲价值观的政策文件。详细阐述周边外交。

;

; 分析人士表示，习近平的信息和政策文件标志着为地区和世界共同繁荣与和平释放的重大红利，并有助于安抚北京方面的信心。习近平在贺电中将中国周边外交的目标概括为“与邻为善、以邻为伴，构建睦邻友好邻邦”。十年来，中国积极践行这一外交理念，政治互信不断增强，融合不断深化。习近平表示，为丰富“亲诚惠容”理念，中国将弘扬以和平、包容为核心的亚洲价值观。合作、包容、融合，为地区团结、开放、进步提供新动力。

;

; 中国将确保中国现代化道路更多惠及周边国家。将共同推进亚洲现代化进程，使中国高质量发展与良好周边环境相辅相成。

;

; 中国将“与地区国家一道，建设和平安宁、繁荣美丽、友好共处的亚洲家园，共同谱写推动构建亚洲和人类命运共同体的新篇章”，

;

; 领导学者表示，10年来，在习近平同志的带领下，中国在经济全球化进程中经历风风雨雨，勇敢行动，推动同周边国家开放、合作共赢。 ”中国正在推进经济和社会议程。

;

;在谈到 COVID-19 大流行时，他表示两国“在需要时相互支持”。

;

;蒙古国总理额尔登呼吁世界主要国家“以中国的价值观和原则为榜样，为人类和平共处事业作出贡献”。

;

; 他表示，今年是“一带一路”倡议和“亲诚惠容”理念提出10周年。

;

; 中国提出“一带一路”倡议他在预先录制的视频讲话中表示，“一带一路”倡议是一个开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的、开放的“一带一路”倡议。”中国，在不久的将来我们将有五个铁路道口。建设工作正在紧锣密鼓地进行。这只是“一带一路”在中国周边国家落地生根的一个具体例子。”

;

; 中国科学院日本研究所所长杨伯江社科院院长表示，中国有14个陆地邻国、8个海上邻国，是世界上为数不多的邻国众多、地缘政治环境复杂的大国之一。

;

; 在“亲诚惠容”的指导下杨洁篪表示，“中国与周边国家的合作特别是经贸领域和推进‘一带一路’建设空前发展，互为重要合作伙伴”。

;

; ;四点建议;

;

;在周二的座谈会上，外交部长王毅转达了习近平的讲话，并向听众展示了题为《展望》的政策文件副本北京大学全球合作与理解研究院执行院长、教授王东表示，习近平总书记在新时代中国周边外交政策上发表了重要讲话。

;

;这一信息和政策文件发出了一个非常重要的信号，即凝心聚力、构建周边命运共同体是中国外交的优先方向，具有“重大战略意义”。

;

; “今天是周边外交的新起点，为建设亚洲更加美好的共同家园而扬帆起航，需要中国与邻国更多共同努力。”

;

; 王毅代表北京提出四点建议，呼吁亚洲邻国共同将本地区打造成共建“一带一路”的典范、实现全球发展倡议的排头兵

;

; 贸易方面，他提出力争年底前完成中国-东盟自贸区3.0版谈判

;

; 关于亚洲共同安全，外交部长强调，各国要“反对外部势力干涉地区国家内政”。 “决不允许地缘政治冲突的悲剧在本地区上演”。

;

; 此外，“对于历史遗留的争议，中方愿通过协商和协商寻求公平合理的解决方案”。

;

; 巴基斯坦参议院议长穆罕默德·萨迪克·桑吉拉尼赞同习近平的观点，即“世界面临百年未有之大变局”，并表示，地缘政治紧张局势是全球性挑战的主要因素。

;

; 他呼吁各国“走出冲突阴影，拥抱对话”，“亲诚互利，互利共赢”。包容性”中国国际问题研究院院长陈波强调，要进一步审视、更深层次地认识实践的理论价值“亲诚惠容”理念。

;

; “当前，世界变革正在加速演变。”这既有分裂对抗的危险，也有团结合作的机遇。”她说。

;印尼雅加达-万隆高铁线路首次实现商业乘客乘坐。; ;

;乘客乘坐雅加达首趟商业航班-印度尼西亚万隆高铁。

; ;

;乘客首次乘坐印尼雅加达-万隆高铁的商业出行。

; ;

;乘客首次乘坐印尼雅加达-万隆高铁线路的商业出行。

; ;

;一列高铁在雅加达等待离开车站。

; ;

;10月11日，一列运行在雅万高铁上的列车在印度尼西亚普哇​​加达过河。该线路于10月2日开通，10月17日开始商业运营。

;

;阿里·穆斯托法(Ali Mustofa)按照中国教练的指导，坐在控制台上尝试启动模拟高铁列车

;

; 在印度尼西亚万隆高铁站接受训练时，穆斯托法在屏幕上输入了火车号码和司机 ID 详细信息，教练穆真仔细观看。

;

;“保持手指直立可以帮助您避免无意中触摸任何东西，”

;

; 穆斯托法随后推动模拟设备上的控制杆，在他面前的大屏幕上显示风景，随着火车的开走，风景逐渐远去。他继续按操纵杆控制速度。

;

; 随着火车加速，他读出“每小时45公里、每小时80公里、每小时150公里。”当最高时速达到350公里时，他说：“好快啊！”

;

; 穆告诉他，“第一次可能会觉得头晕，但不要” 39；不用担心，你会习惯的。”

;

; Mustofa 正在使用的模拟器进行训练，该模拟器正用于指导印度尼西亚第一批高铁司机，由中国建造，相关景观以1：1的比例再现。

;

;雅万高铁（HSR），“一带一路”标志性项目，或“一带一路”，是用中国技术建造的。全长142.3公里，连接印度尼西亚首都雅加达和西爪哇省万隆。

;

; 这是东南亚第一条高铁服务。该线路最高时速350公里/小时，与此前印尼铁路最高时速120公里/小时形成鲜明对比。

;

; 印尼总统佐科·维多多于10月2日为该线路剪彩，并开始通车。 10 月 17 日投入商业运营。

;

; 中国官员计划将该技术转让给印度尼西亚，使该国能够在未来几年独立运营高速铁路系统。为实现这一目标，中方已培训了包括穆斯托法在内的4.5万多名印尼人员。

;

; 从事火车司机工作10多年的穆斯托法去年被选中参加雅万高铁培训计划。他完成了六个月的工作理论培训并顺利通过笔试。

;

; 在接下来的几个月里，他将接受经验丰富的中国讲师的实践指导。完成全面培训后，Mustofa 将完全具备成为印度尼西亚首批高速列车司机之一的能力。

;

; 他出生于一个在铁路行业有着悠久历史的家庭，他他为自己的父亲是一名火车司机而感到无比自豪。穆斯托法说，在他的童年时期，他父亲驾驶的火车在线路的所有车站都会停下来，让他有机会悠闲地登上火车。

;

; 谈到他的理论训练，穆斯托法说他面临的最初障碍是

;

; 2月下旬，他与中国铁路机构组织的雅万高铁人员一起接受培训。印尼团队的培训是在线进行的，每节课都有翻译，以解决语言障碍。

;

; Mustofa第一次熟悉了列车的电力系统，这提出了相当大的挑战。印度尼西亚的大多数火车均由内燃机提供动力。相比之下，高铁是通过电力来实现快速运行的。

;

; “中国教练非常有耐心。他们放慢解释概念的速度，直到我们理解它们为止。”穆斯托法说。

;

; 他的中文教练穆是一名拥有八年驾驶经验的高铁司机。经验。穆去年10月赴印尼参加雅万高铁试运营。他目前的任务是协助穆斯托法等印尼火车司机。

;

; “语言障碍和缺乏电力来源都不是问题。一切都会好起来的，”

;

; ;亮点;

;

;雅万高铁项目是第一个完全依赖中国铁路系统、技术和零部件的海外项目。< /p>;

; 中国铁路国际有限公司董事长鞠国江表示：“该项目的最大特点无疑是速度。这是中国境外建设的第一条最高时速350公里的高速铁路。”

;

; 中老铁路设计最高时速160公里，而中老铁路设计最高时速160公里。正在建设中的匈塞铁路，预计最高时速可达200​​公里。

;

; 雅加达-万隆高铁是中国和印尼双方共同努力的成果。两国于 2015 年 10 月签署协议，成立一家合资企业来建设和运营该项目，该项目于 2018 年开始施工。

;

; Dwiyana Slamet Riyadi，PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia 中国公司总裁兼董事，或KCIC 表示，“我们在建设、运营和维护方面进行了合作。”

;

; KCIC 是印度尼西亚国有企业财团 PT Pilar Sinergi BUMN 与北京亚湾公司的合资企业，

;

; Riyadi 表示，该项目的大部分建筑工人是印尼人，雇用了 15,000 人。中国员工相当于7名印尼员工。

;

; 雅万高铁有13座隧道、56座桥梁。这些列车针对印度尼西亚的热带气候进行了改造，配备了能够应对地震、洪水和其他紧急情况的安全系统。

;

; 中国驻印尼大使陆康印尼表示，“这个高铁项目是友好国家之间互信互助的典范。”在此期间，两国团队密切合作，相互支持，度过困难和挑战。”

;

;未来几年，印尼有望完全具备独立运营新高铁的能力。

;

;里亚迪说：“我们预见到技术和知识的顺利转移。我们预计这个过程需要一到两年的时间。”

;

; ;缩短出行时间;

;

;中国已与“一带一路”沿线国家和地区建立联系倡议，旨在用其经验和技术支持更多国家的发展。然而，中国行动背后的动机受到了一些国际评论人士的质疑。

;

; 针对这些担忧，里亚迪表示，“我们将从这个项目中受益，特别是在经济和区域方面。” ”

;

; 这条高速线路连接雅加达和西爪哇人口稠密的首府万隆，为人口提供服务4000万人次，将两座城市之间的出行时间从三个多小时大幅缩短至仅需40分钟。

;

; 世界银行表示，实施“一带一路”框架内的所有项目将为全球带来约1.6万亿美元的收入到2030年，每年的收入将占到全球GDP的1.3%，其中90%的利益由参与合作伙伴分享。

;

; 陆说，“从2015年到2030年，将有近4000万人得到提升” “一带一路”下的脱贫攻坚。”

;

;新线350公里/小时的高运营速度，激励着司机穆斯托法研究高铁技术。< /p>;

; “因为我要负责这样的速度下乘客的安全，所以我感到压力很大。”

;

; 这种责任激励着穆斯托法的导师穆，让他的学生产生敬畏之心。

;

; “当我还是一名练习生时，我的导师告诉我要怀着敬畏之心对待高铁，这样我才能专心工作，安全运送乘客。我希望穆斯托法能够培养这种敬畏感。这是我想传递给他的最重要的事情。”

;

; 穆斯托法希望在未来几个月内完全掌握驾驶子弹头列车的技术，作为他的国家首批高铁司机之一在历史上留下自己的印记。

;

; 中国最高立法机关第十四届全国人民代表大会常务委员会第六次会议周二在北京闭幕。

;

;闭幕会议，全国人大常委会表决通过了修订后的海洋环境保护法、爱国主义教育法以及官员任免的决定。

;

; 免去李尚福的国务委员兼国防部长职务。决定，免去王志刚的国务委员职务，免去王志刚的科技部长职务，免去刘昆的财政部部长职务。

;

; 任命尹和君为科技部部长任命兰佛安为财政部长。

;

;国家主席习近平签署主席令公布并实施决定。

;

;赵乐际，董事长全国人大常委会主持了会议。

;

; 全国人大常委会通过了国务院在第四季度发行1万亿元人民币（1,367.9亿美元）特别国债的决定。

;

;筹集的资金将主要用于灾后重建、防洪治理工程、自然灾害应急能力提升工程。

;

; 最高立法机关还决定授权国务院批准部分项目的最高限额。提前偿还地方政府债务。

;

; 立法者批准了中国和哥伦比亚之间的被判刑人员移管条约以及与毛里求斯的引渡条约。

;

; 他们批准了《打击非法制造毒品议定书》和贩运枪支及其零部件和弹药，对《联合国打击跨国有组织犯罪公约》进行补充。

;

; 立法者批准了《秘书处、其人员和成员国代表的特权和豁免公约》。亚洲相互协作与信任措施会议。

;

; Wed, 25 Oct 2023 04:21:05 +0800 002PAGE TWO - CHINA HELPS INDONESIA HIT THE FAST TRACKhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/25/content_002_653824cbed50d203d2ca1354.htm#002PAGE TWO
;
;; ;

;印尼雅加达-万隆高铁线路首次实现商业乘客乘坐。; ;

;乘客乘坐雅加达首趟商业航班-印度尼西亚万隆高铁。

; ;

;乘客首次乘坐印尼雅加达-万隆高铁的商业出行。

; ;

;乘客首次乘坐印尼雅加达-万隆高铁线路的商业出行。

; ;

;一列高铁在雅加达等待出站。

; ;

;10月11日，一列运行在雅万高铁线上的列车在印度尼西亚普哇​​加达过河。该线路于10月2日开通，10月17日开始商业运营。

;

;阿里·穆斯托法(Ali Mustofa)按照中国教练的指导，坐在控制台上尝试启动模拟高铁列车

;

; 在印度尼西亚万隆高铁站接受训练时，穆斯托法在屏幕上输入了火车号码和司机 ID 详细信息，教练穆真仔细观看。

;

;“保持手指直立可以帮助您避免无意中触摸任何东西，”

;

; 穆斯托法随后推动模拟设备上的控制杆，在他面前的大屏幕上显示风景，随着火车的开走，风景逐渐远去。他继续按操纵杆控制速度。

;

; 随着火车加速，他读出“每小时45公里、每小时80公里、每小时150公里。”当最高时速达到350公里时，他说：“好快啊！”

;

; 穆告诉他，“第一次可能会觉得头晕，但不要” 39；不用担心，你会习惯的。”

;

; Mustofa 正在使用的模拟器进行训练，该模拟器正用于指导印度尼西亚第一批高铁司机，由中国建造，相关景观以1：1的比例再现。

;

;雅万高铁（HSR），“一带一路”标志性项目，或“一带一路”，是用中国技术建造的。全长142.3公里，连接印度尼西亚首都雅加达和西爪哇省万隆。

;

; 这是东南亚第一条高铁服务。该线路最高时速350公里/小时，与此前印尼铁路最高时速120公里/小时形成鲜明对比。

;

; 印尼总统佐科·维多多于10月2日为该线路剪彩，并开始通车。 10 月 17 日投入商业运营。

;

; 中国官员计划将该技术转让给印度尼西亚，使该国能够在未来几年独立运营高速铁路系统。为实现这一目标，中方已培训了包括穆斯托法在内的4.5万多名印尼人员。

;

; 从事火车司机工作10多年的穆斯托法去年被选中参加雅万高铁培训计划。他完成了六个月的工作theoretical training and successfully passed a written examination.

;

; In the coming months, he is due to receive practical supervision from an experienced Chinese instructor. On completing his comprehensive training, Mustofa will be fully equipped to become one of Indonesia's first high-speed train drivers.

;

; Born to a family with a long history of working in the railway industry, he is extremely proud that his father was a train driver. Mustofa said that during his childhood, trains driven by his father halted at all stops on a line, giving him the opportunity to board at leisure.

;

; Discussing his theoretical training, Mustofa said the initial hurdle he faced was the language barrier.

;

; In late February, he was part of a group of personnel undergoing training for the Jakarta-Bandung HSR in a program conducted by Chinese railway institutions. The training was given online to the Indonesian team, and a translator was used for each session to get around the language barrier.

;

; Mustofa familiarized himself with the train's electric power system for the first time, which posed a considerable challenge. Most trains in Indonesia are powered by internal combustion engines. In contrast, high-speed trains use electricity to achieve their rapid operational speeds.

;

; "The Chinese instructors are extremely patient. They slow down to explain concepts until we understand them," Mustofa said.

;

; Mu, his Chinese instructor, is a high-speed train driver with eight years' experience. Mu traveled to Indonesia in October last year to take part in the trial operation of the Jakarta-Bandung HSR. His current task is to assist Indonesian train drivers such as Mustofa.

;

; "The language barrier and a lack of sources of electricity are not a problem. It will all be fine," Mu said.

;

; ;Standout feature;

;

; The Jakarta-Bandung HSR project is the first overseas venture to rely wholly on Chinese railway systems, technology and components.

;

; Ju Guojiang, chairman of China Railway International Co, said: "The project's main feature is undoubtedly its speed. It is the first high-speed railway built outside of China to have a top speed of 350 kilometers per hour."

;

; The China-Laos Railway was designed with a maximum speed of 160 km/h, while the Hungary-Serbia Railway, which is still under construction, has a projected top speed of 200 km/h.

;

; The Jakarta-Bandung HSR is the result of joint efforts by participants from China and Indonesia. The two nations signed an agreement in October 2015 to establish a joint venture to build and operate the project, for which construction began in 2018.

;

; Dwiyana Slamet Riyadi, president-director of PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China, or KCIC, said, "We worked together on construction, operation and maintenance."

;

; KCIC is a joint venture between PT Pilar Sinergi BUMN, a consortium of Indonesian government-owned companies, and Beijing Yawan Co, a syndicate of Chinese railway companies.

;

; Riyadi said most of the construction workers for the project were Indonesian, with 15,000 people employed. There were seven Indonesian workers for every Chinese employee.

;

; The Jakarta-Bandung high-speed line boasts 13 tunnels and 56 bridges. The trains, which have been adapted for Indonesia's tropical climate, are equipped with a safety system that responds to earthquakes, floods and other emergency situations.

;

; Lu Kang, China's ambassador to Indonesia, said, "This high-speed railway project is a very fine example of the mutual trust and mutual assistance among friendly countries.

;

; "From inception to completion, and despite the challenges faced during the construction period, teams from both countries cooperated closely, supporting each other through difficulties and challenges."

;

; In the coming years, Indonesia is expected to become fully equipped to operate the new high-speed line independently.

;

; Riyadi said: "We foresee a smooth transfer of technology and knowledge. We expect this process to take one to two years."

;

; ;Travel time cut;

;

; China has liaised with nations and regions involved in the Belt and Road Initiative, aiming to use its experience and technology to support the development of more countries. However, the motives behind China's actions have been questioned by some international commentators.

;

; Responding to these concerns, Riyadi said, "We will benefit from this project, particularly in terms of economic and regional growth, as well as later, when the high-speed route has been operational for some time."

;

; Connecting Jakarta with Bandung, the heavily populated capital of West Java, the high-speed line serves a population of 40 million, drastically reducing travel time between the two cities from more than three hours to just 40 minutes.

;

; The World Bank has said that implementing all the projects within the BRI framework will generate about $1.6 trillion in global revenue annually by 2030. This would account for 1.3 percent of global GDP, with 90 percent of the benefits shared among participating partners.

;

; Lu said, "From 2015 to 2030, almost 40 million people will be lifted out of poverty under the auspices of the BRI."

;

; The new line's high operating speed of 350 km/h is motivating Mustofa, the driver, to study high-speed rail technology.

;

; "As I am responsible for the safety of passengers traveling at such a speed, I feel a great deal of pressure," Mustofa said.

;

; This responsibility is inspiring Mu, Mustofa's instructor, to instill a sense of awe in his pupil.

;

; "When I was a trainee, my instructor told me to regard high-speed trains with a sense of awe so that I could concentrate on my work and transport passengers safely. I hope Mustofa can develop this sense of awe. It is the most important thing I want to pass on to him," Mu said.

;

; Mustofa hopes to fully master the technology for driving bullet trains in the next few months to make his mark on history as one of his country's first high-speed train drivers.

; Wed, 25 Oct 2023 04:21:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Security meet to enhance mutual trusthttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/25/content_003_653824ceed50d203d2ca1355.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

; The United States Department of Defense is sending a delegation to attend the 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum, which starts on Sunday. More than 20 defense ministers from around the world will participate in the high-level security conference.

;

; Organizers said the three-day security forum aims to help countries enhance mutual trust and strengthen the voice of developing nations.

;

; According to the forum's organizing committee, Cynthia Xanthi Carras, country director for China in the Office of the Undersecretary of Defense for Policy, has registered on the official website of the forum, and will attend the forum as head of the US delegation.

;

; In addition, Chad Sbragia, former deputy assistant secretary of defense for China in the Office of the US Secretary of Defense, will also attend the forum as an expert. The former US official had attended the forum's last gathering in 2019 and is the highest-level official sent by the US side to participate in the security conference so far.

;

; Zhao Yufei, deputy secretary-general of the organizing committee, said that as of Monday, more than 90 delegations from countries and international organizations had confirmed their participation, including from Russia, the US, Iran, Singapore, Nigeria, South Korea and Saudi Arabia.

;

; Among them are 22 senior officials of defense minister level and above and 14 representatives of the military chief-of-staff level, he said.

;

; In addition, high-ranking officials and representatives from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, the League of Arab States, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the European Union will also participate in the conference, said Zhao.

;

; The number and seniority level of participants have reached a record high, the organizers said, noting that the participation of developing countries and international and regional organizations in particular have increased significantly.

;

; Over 200 experts from more than 50 countries and regions have also registered for the conference.

;

; While the US has sent delegations to the Beijing Xiangshan Forum several times, the contingents earlier did not comprise very senior officials.

;

; Luo Xi, a researcher at the People's Liberation Army Academy of Military Sciences, said: "On the one hand, this reflects that the US is paying attention to the forum, but on the other hand, they are unwilling to show any endorsement for the security event hosted by the Chinese side."

;

; Luo added that US participation indicates that military exchanges between the two countries have not been interrupted.

;

; "Although there are difficulties in China-US relations at present, both countries still retain the necessary communication channels, especially when engagements in multiple fields between China and US have become more frequent," she said.

;

; On Tuesday, the Foreign Ministry announced that Foreign Minister Wang Yi will visit the US on Thursday.

;

; Since June, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo have successively visited China, increasing the frequency and scope of high-level official exchanges between China and the US.

;

; According to the forum's organizing committee, the forum will comprise four plenary sessions and a series of seminars and breakout sessions. The topics cover global security issues of concern, including the role of African countries in the Russia-Ukraine conflict, security situations in areas covered by the Belt and Road Initiative, and the war risks created by artificial intelligence.

;

; In addition, the forum encourages delegations from developing countries, especially small and medium-sized nations, to participate in the dialogue and voice their opinions, expanding the discourse power and influence of developing countries in global security governance.

;

; Luo said the voices of developing nations are becoming increasingly important, especially when global peace is elusive amid conflicts and wars in various places.

;

; "Despite their different development paths, China and other developing countries have a common desire — no more wars and conflicts," she said.

;

; China is willing to stand with other developing countries, and oppose hegemony and power politics, which have been threatening global peace and stability, she said.

; Wed, 25 Oct 2023 04:21:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Strict penalties imposed on illegal fishinghttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-10/25/content_003_653824d7ed50d203d2ca1358.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;

; Authorities in China have levied fines worth more than 1 billion yuan ($137 million) on Chinese companies for fishing illegally in international waters since 2016, a white paper said on Tuesday.

;

; The penalties were part of an intensified push by the world's leading seafood exporter to promote a more sustainable approach to deep-sea fishing as it looks to blue waters to meet food security needs, said the report compiled by the State Council Information Office.

;

; The report, titled "Development of China's Deep-Sea Fishing Industry", said it was aimed at introducing China's stance, principles and approach on deep-sea fishing, and serves as a window to China's expertise in managing fishing operations.

;

; A total of 177 Chinese companies and 2,551 fishing trawlers are currently authorized to fish on the high seas across the Pacific, Indian and Atlantic oceans, the waters near the Antarctic and the waters administered by China's partners, and their annual output is roughly 2.3 million metric tons, the white paper said.

;

; The report said that six Chinese companies have been permanently disqualified from fishing offshore since 2016, while operations of another 22 have been temporarily suspended due to minor offenses over the same period. Some of the offenders were reported by foreign governments and international organizations.

;

; "China strictly policed its footprint in deep-sea fishing and maintained zero tolerance toward misconduct through legislation and administrative law enforcement measures," it said, adding that China had adopted a digital logging system to prevent overfishing of tuna, squid and saury, among others.

;

; The white paper highlighted China's support for multilateral crackdown on illegal fishing. Such endeavors include deploying law enforcement vessels regularly in the North Pacific Ocean, starting in 2020, and barring sanctioned fishing boats from refueling and replenishing supplies at Chinese ports under a regional pact since 2018.

;

; As a front-runner in harvesting deep-sea catch known for their health benefits, China's presence in offshore fishing grounds can be traced back to more than 4,000 years ago.

;

; Modern deep-sea fishing picked up in China in 1985, as it launched bilateral cooperation with over 40 countries spread across Asia, Africa, South America and Oceania.

;

; China also participated in multilateral fishery management under the framework of the United Nations and in the spirit of international laws, and supported research aimed at protecting sea mammals and other endangered species, the report said.

;

; Since embracing the concept of ecological civilization in 2012, the country has been working to limit fishing intensity and combat illegal practices to ensure responsible and sustainable use of ocean resources, it said.

;

; As part of the efforts, China implemented in 2020 a self-imposed, three-month trial moratorium on fishing in international waters in Southwest Atlantic and East Pacific. The fishing ban became a formal policy the next year.

;

; The country's 14th Five-Year Plan (2021-25) capped the number of deep-sea fishing boats at 3,000 and limited their total catch to below 2.3 million tons a year.

;

; China exported 3.74 million tons of aquatic products in 2020 to the United States, Europe, Southeast Asia and Japan, among others, which made up 12 percent of the world's total exports of aquatic products that year, according to the General Administration of Customs.
